alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 12:15PM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY FOR THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN ABOVE 6500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE TAHOE BASIN ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Winter Weather Advisory above 6500 feet. Snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts of 8 to 14 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with gusts to 70 mph along Sierra ridges. For the Winter Storm Watch for the Tahoe Basin above 7000 feet, heavy snow. Snow accumulations 8 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts of 12 to 18 inches. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact daily commutes through Monday night. Check with CalTrans or NDOT for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
